intro: Dorstenia cuspidata var. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental curling plant, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its unique, curling leaves that resemble tendrils. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its distinctive foliage makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and indoor plant collections.
